alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 2:36AM MDT until June 15 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE UPPER TRANS PECOS AND CULBERSON COUNTY INCLUDING THE GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS, 20 FOOT WINDS GREATER THAN 20 MPH AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE UPPER TRANS PECOS AND CULBERSON COUNTY INCLUDING THE GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITIES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS, 20 FOOT WINDS GREATER THAN 20 MPH AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... * TIMING...Thursday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * RFTI...7 or extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
